newsitem.title: INDIA: India bank strike deferred on political turmoil.
newsitem.headline: India bank strike deferred on political turmoil.

text.p: Indian bank trade unions have deferred a strike by bank employees planned for April 4 due to the political crisis facing the country, a union leader said on Tuesday.

"Given the uncertainty in the political climate at present, we have decided to defer the strike as it appears no-one can take a decision," said the chief of a state-run bank officers' union in Bombay.
India's minority government was thrown into turmoil by the Congress party's decision on Sunday to withdraw support.
Congress support had propped up the ruling United Front (UF) coalition.
The bank strike had been called to protest the government's decision to allow private sector local banks to be set up in rural areas.
Bank unions also wanted a pension scheme, applicable to state-run banks, to be implemented by private sector banks.
The trade union leader stressed that the strike had only been deferred and not cancelled.
